meanings.definition: Misbiasses: to unfairly influence or distort someone's judgment or opinion.
meanings.sent1: The biased news report misbiasses the viewers' understanding of the situation.
meanings.sent2: She always misbiasses the facts to make herself look better.
meanings.sent3: The cat misbiasses the dog's opinion of the new toy by hiding it.
meanings.sent4: His loud voice misbiasses the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds misbiass the sunny day, making it seem gloomy.

meanings.definition: Misbiasses: a tendency or inclination towards unfair judgment or opinion.
meanings.sent1: Her misbiasses often lead her to jump to conclusions without all the facts.
meanings.sent2: The misbiasses of the jury affected the outcome of the trial.
meanings.sent3: The misbiasses of the cat towards the new food made the dog curious to try it.
meanings.sent4: His misbiasses are like a fog that clouds his ability to see things clearly.
meanings.sent5: The misbiasses of the teacher towards certain students were evident in her grading.
